content.description: Just to the right ‘Stamp Collection’, start in the thin obtuse corner on some crimps. Boulder up through two bolts on crimps and slopers to get established on the slab. Join up with the last two bolts of ‘Stamp Collection’. Optional finger size cam between the 2nd and 3rd bolt.
content.location: Just to the right ‘Stamp Collection’, start in the thin obtuse corner on some crimps.

content.description: Locate the giant hueco at the top of the crag.  This climb moves up and to the right of the hueco.  Start matched on a horizontal crack and move up through some decent edges and crimps.  Use the diagonal crimp rail to move past the first small roof.  Some great hidden finger slots in the hueco roof section will help you through the crux.
content.location: Locate the giant hueco at the top of the crag.  This climb moves up and to the right of the hueco.

content.description: Start as per ‘Delivery’ and climb up through the first 3 bolts and then move up and right through the roof section.

Just to the right of going postal and before the arete.  Look for the large jug ledge to start matched on,  just above some stacked rock.  Make way off the ground trending up and slightly right.  Deliver the crimpy crux below the anchors for the send.

climbs.name: Postmaster General
climbs.fa: FA:  Aaron Parlier 6/25/2019, Equipped: Marshall Gilbert 4/30/2017

content.description: Starts under the roof bulge on the arete, before the cave around the corner.   Look for the large rock platform built for the start.  The Crux is the first 3 - 4 moves (stick clip, or crash pad recommended).  Start matched on the left facing crescent hold under the roof, throw a left heel and find the small hidden crimp up and right.  Some delicate face climbing will get you to the top.  Look for some side pulls around the right bulge to gain the anchors.
content.location: Starts under the roof bulge on the arete, before the cave around the corner.

content.description: Located in the far back corner of the cave between Postal wall and Trade Wall.  Look for the blocky horizontal ledge that sticks out cave with a bolt at the upper left point.  Stick clip as the start is the crux move.  Start matched below on the rail with a great left hand and decent right hand and throw up a left heel to reach for the huge ledge above.  Make the mantle and avoid the loose blocks if possible.  Trend up and left, and pull the roof.  There is a nice tree to take a lean on if needed.  Easy slab terrain leads to the anchors up and right.
content.location: Located in the far back corner of the cave between Postal wall and Trade Wall.

content.description: Locate the giant hueco near the top of the crag.  This will be the bolted line that runs just left of the hueco and is the first route on the crag. Start on a decent horizontal crack and begin moving straight up and slightly left through some crimps and small iron holds. Crux at 3rd bolt in the blank section and moving into the crack.  A big chicken head and a couple of smaller holds will take you to the anchors!
content.location: Locate the giant hueco near the top of the crag.  This will be the bolted line that runs just left of the hueco and is the first route on the crag.

content.description: Look for the black streak in the middle of the postal wall, about 10 feet or so before the arete feature.   Start on a large layback slot that leads to some larger holds above.  Move up and left working through some crimps and following the black streak.  Have fun going postal at the 2nd bolt!

Look for the old spray painted symbol that resembles a Menorah.  This climb starts a few feet to the right.  Stick clip and look for the stacked rocks to allow you to reach a right facing edge.  Get matched up and make a big left move to the crack up and left.  Move up and right through some fun steep climbing and make sure to leave some gas in the tank for the crux move just below the anchors.  A left hand crimp will give way to a dyno, or a techy static  move!

Next climb after ‘Postmaster General’.  Look for the low dihedral that quickly breaks into a roof.  Start on a raised rock platform.  The crux is the first couple of moves.  Work up feet and figure out the delivery mantle.  Once established under the roof begin working up and left onto the face, which makes way to some easier climbing.
content.location: Next climb after ‘Postmaster General’.  Look for the low dihedral that quickly breaks into a roof.

climbs.name: Chainmail
climbs.fa: FA: Aaron Parlier 9/9/2019, Bolted: Aaron Parlier/Marshall Gilbert 8/4/2019

content.description: Find this one on the far right side of the Postal Crag under the steep wave-like roof. Follow the three chains down and find the long diagonal rail. Below that is the starting jug ledge. Stick Clip the first chain and charge up the steep cave. Enter the first boulder problem when you reach the first chain. Shake out and regain what you can in the horizontal crack below the blank roof and clip the next two chains from there. Go to battle with the crux bulge boulder problem and then take it past the next two bolts. Stand up on the ledge and the anchors are a breeze.
content.location: Far right side of the Postal Crag under the steep wave-like roof.

content.description: An amazing and beautiful wall with some short stout climbs.  It is located just a minute or so past the Mammal Wall going downstream towards the Guest River.
